articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as India play Sri Lanka in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Gill & Kohli steer India past 50-1 against Sri Lanka

articles.description: All the latest reaction to Wednesday night's EFL Cup action, including Manchester United v Newcastle.
articles.title: EFL Cup reaction and more football news

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has vowed to fight on after seeing his side thrashed by Newcastle in the EFL Cup fourth round.
articles.title: Ten Hag vows to 'fight on' - but 'questions' grow for Man Utd boss

articles.description: The story behind England's 2003 World Cup elimination, which was partly because of their decision not to play Zimbabwe in Harare.
articles.title: When politics derailed England's World Cup campaign

articles.description: Last season's runners-up Newcastle play at Chelsea in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals, while Liverpool face West Ham.
articles.title: Chelsea to play Newcastle in EFL Cup quarter-finals

articles.description: Watch as India captain Rohit Sharma is bowled by Sri Lanka's Dilshan Madushanka with only the second ball during their World Cup match in Mumbai.
articles.title: India skipper Rohit bowled second ball by Madushanka

articles.description: After going blind following a rare reaction to food poisoning, cyclist Lizzi Jordan is now aiming for Paralympic success.
articles.title: Cyclist told she 'might not pull through' targets Paris Paralympics

articles.description: In his BBC Sport column, Barry Jones backs Joe Cordina in his first world title defence and says a fight with Leigh Wood next would be perfect for the Welshman.
articles.title: Wood fight perfect fit for special Cordina - Jones

articles.description: The Texas Rangers are World Series champions for the first time in their history after beating the Arizona Diamondbacks 5-0 to clinch the series 4-1.
articles.title: Texas Rangers clinch maiden World Series title

articles.description: As Worthing get ready to play in the FA Cup first round, George Dowell says becoming owner has given him a sense of purpose after a car crash changed his life forever.
articles.title: 'As much as I saved Worthing, Worthing saved me'
